definition: throwing something heavy with great effort, breathe noisily, as when one is exhausted
details:
noun
- throwing something heavy with great effort
= example: throwing something heavy with great effort
= synonyms: heaving
- the act of raising something
= synonyms: lift, raise
- an involuntary spasm of ineffectual vomiting
= example: an involuntary spasm of ineffectual vomiting
= synonyms: retch
- the act of lifting something with great effort
= synonyms: heaving
- (geology) a horizontal dislocation
- an upward movement (especially a rhythmical rising and falling)
= synonyms: heaving
verb
- breathe noisily, as when one is exhausted
= synonyms: gasp, pant, puff
- make an unsuccessful effort to vomit
= synonyms: retch, gag
- bend out of shape, as under pressure or from heat
= synonyms: buckle, warp
- utter a sound, as with obvious effort
= example: utter a sound, as with obvious effort
- lift or elevate
= synonyms: heft, heave up, heft up
- throw with great effort
- rise and move, as in waves or billows
= synonyms: surge
- move or cause to move in a specified way, direction, or position
